impact_weight: The reduction of greenhouse gas emissions can lead to improved air quality by decreasing the amount of pollutants released into the atmosphere, thus reinforcing the achievement of air quality targets.
Reducing GHG emissions can also contribute to improving water quality by decreasing the amount of pollutants that enter water bodies, thus aiding in the achievement of water quality targets.
The reduction of pesticide use is indivisibly linked to improving soil health, as pesticides can contaminate soil and harm its quality, making it essential for achieving soil health targets.
Promoting competitive agriculture can enable the achievement of air quality targets by encouraging the use of more environmentally friendly farming practices, which can reduce air pollution.

Protecting workers' rights and promoting fair income can reinforce the achievement of social security and sanitation targets by ensuring that workers have access to safe and healthy working conditions.
Ensuring food affordability can enable the achievement of food quality targets by making healthy and sustainable food options more accessible to consumers.
Promoting animal welfare in food production can reinforce the achievement of healthy food targets by ensuring that food is produced in a way that prioritizes animal health and well-being.
Reducing pesticide use is indivisibly linked to achieving healthy food targets, as pesticides can contaminate food and harm human health, making it essential for ensuring the quality of food.
